data.question: What is the name of the new organic-inorganic hybrid framework based on titanium oxide reported in the study?
What phenomenon is attributed to USTC-700's ability to absorb more D2 than H2 at low temperatures?
At what temperature range does USTC-700 show high D2/H2 selectivity?
What is the D2/H2 selectivity range demonstrated by USTC-700?
Is the structure of USTC-700 new or previously known?
data.answer: The structure of USTC-700 is new.

data.question: What is the purity level of D2 gas used in the USTC-700 experiments?
What method is used to determine physisorption isotherms in the study?
What technique is used to study the separation processes in USTC-700?
Why does USTC-700 have a higher selectivity for D2 over H2 in mixture measurements?
data.answer: Due to fast kinetics and more favorable sorption affinity caused by electrostatic effect from the functional groups.

data.question: Can the selectivity of D2/H2 by TDS be overestimated due to the method used in the study?
data.answer: No, an overestimation of the selectivity by TDS can be confidently ruled out as numerous measurements on multiple samples have shown high reproducibility.

data.question: Does USTC-700 use a pure or mixed gas for TDS measurements?

Does the TDS technique involve reaching equilibrium before measurement?
Is the purity of H2 gas used in the experiments higher than that of D2?
Are the adsorption/desorption kinetics for H2/D2 on USTC-700 considered slow?

Can gas impurities be a reason for the observed TDS peaks in the USTC-700 study?
Is the selectivity for D2 over H2 in USTC-700 due to the presence of strong adsorption sites?
Does USTC-700 demonstrate a quantum sieving effect at temperatures above 77 K?
Is the thermal desorption spectroscopy (TDS) technique used in the USTC-700 study a standard surface science technique?
